data.title: New Family Movies Coming Out in 2024
data.meta_description: Mark your calendars and plan the perfect family outing to the cinemas to check out the best new family movies coming out in 2024.
data.text:
If there's one thing most parents look forward to at the culmination of yet another year of parenting, it's not a long and luxurious end-of-year holiday (when do parents ever get a holiday?), it's the list of new family movies coming out!

Family movies are our saving grace when it comes to rainy weekends, school holidays, or just a day when you need the kids to focus their attention on something other than you. So get ready to mark your calendars for all the trips to the cinema you'll be making in 2024!

New Family Movies Coming Out in 2024

1. IF

Release date: 16 May 2024

John Krasinski is back in the director's chair for IF, an acronym that stands for Imaginary Friends and is, you guessed it, a new family movie about imaginary friends!

More specifically, IF is about a dad and his daughter who discover a world of imaginary friends left behind by their grown-up companions. John Krasinski also stars in IF alongside Ryan Reynolds.

2. The Garfield Movie

Release date: 30 May 2024

2024 looks to be a banner year for movie remakes, as everyone's favourite tubby and cynical orange tabby cat is back on our screens in The Garfield Movie.

Chris Pratt will be voicing the character of Garfield as he and his puppy pal Odie go on a crazy adventure alongside Garfield's long-lost father, Vic.

3. Inside Out 2

Release date: 13 June 2024

Another one of the most highly anticipated new family movies coming out in 2024, the gang from Inside Out is back at headquarters but this time around, there are several new emotions joining the team.

Joy, Sadness, Anger, Fear and Disgust are navigating the mind of teenager Riley when puberty starts to take hold, bringing with it a slew of new emotions, including Anxiety.

There's no official Australian release date for Inside Out 2, but we can expect it to come out sometime in June 2024.

4. Despicable Me 4

Release date: 20 June 2024

The beloved Despicable Me franchise is back with Despicable Me 4 premiering in Australian cinemas in June 2024.

Gru, Lucy, and the girls—Margo, Edith, and Agnes—are introducing a new family member: Gru Jr., who's determined to give his dad a hard time. Meanwhile, Gru faces off against a new villain, Maxime Le Mal, and his partner-in-crime Valentina. With danger on their heels, the family has to go on the run, leading to a series of hilarious and heartwarming escapades.

Expect to hear all your favourite voices return, with Steve Carell and Kristen Wiig reprising their iconic roles.

5. The Sloth Lane

Release date: 25 July 2024

Get ready to slow down and enjoy the ride with The Sloth Lane, a charming and heartwarming Aussie-mation that will steal your heart.

Join Laura and her kooky sloth family as they make a big move to the bustling city, bringing along their prized family recipe book and a rusted old food truck. Will they adapt to life in the fast lane, or will their laid-back lifestyle prove to be just what the city needs?

6. 200% Wolf

Release date: 8 August 2024

Following the heartwarming and hilarious Australian animated feature film 100% Wolf, our beloved hero Freddy Lupin is back with double the excitement and twice the challenges in the highly anticipated new family movie, 200% Wolf.

Get ready for an adventure packed with laughter, magic, and heartwarming moments as Freddy Lupin shows what it truly means to be a leader when 200% Wolf roars into cinemas this August.

7. Coraline 3D

Release date: 15 August 2024

To celebrate the 15th anniversary of Coraline, our favourite 11-year-old is back and ready to dive into a world where creepy meets cool in Coraline 3D.

When Coraline Jones stumbles upon a secret passage in her new house, she's whisked away to a parallel universe that's just like her own—only way better! Or so it seems... With button-eyed parents, a talking cat with attitude, and a world that's just a bit too perfect, Coraline soon realises this alternate reality isn't all it’s cracked up to be.

8. Beetlejuice 2

Release date: 5 September 2024

Say 'Beetlejuice' three times and what will happen?! Beetlejuice will appear, well, more specifically Beetlejuice 2 will appear!

Everyone's favourite bio-exorcist is back in Beetlejuice 2, directed by Tim Burton and starring Michael Keaton. Beetlejuice 2 is the sequel to the 80s comedy in which two ghosts hire Beetlejuice to rid their home of its human inhabitants. While filming on the sequel finished in November 2023, the official plot details are yet to be released - stay tuned!

9. Transformers One

Release date: 12 September 2024

Get ready to dive into the epic saga of Cybertron with Transformers One, the thrilling new family movie that uncovers the untold origin story of the legendary Optimus Prime and Megatron.

Long before they were bitter enemies, these two iconic leaders were friends, bonded like brothers, united by their shared vision for Cybertron's future.

Experience the action, the drama, and the brotherhood that shaped two of the most powerful forces in Cybertronian history

10. Harold and the Purple Crayon

Release date: 12 September 2024

Zachary Levi is serving major nostalgia vibes as he steps into the shoes of a cherished childhood icon in Harold and the Purple Crayon, an adorable new family movie that blur the lines between animation and real life.

Directed by Carlos Saldanha, this spin on Crockett Johnson's timeless tale introduces us to a Harold who's all grown up and stepping – quite literally – out of the storybook and into our world. Harold stirs up a whimsical whirlwind of chaos, thanks to his trusty purple crayon that turns the impossible into "why not?" From unleashing sky-high tarantulas to sketching up an airplane in a snap, it's clear Harold's still got the magic touch, leading us on a wild ride where imagination knows no bounds.

11. The Wild Robot

Release date: 19 September 2024

The Wild Robot zooms into the unexpected saga of Rozzum 7134 (just call her "Roz"), a high-tech robot that finds herself stranded on a remote island like the lead in a sci-fi castaway drama. But plot twist: this metallic castaway turns guardian angel to a lonely gosling she dubs Brightbill.

Together, they're thrust into an epic tale of survival, braving the elements and bonding in ways that would make even the coldest circuits warm. Enter a quirky crew of animal misfits – from sassy squirrels to amiable otters – who morph from strangers to squad, proving that family isn't always wired by DNA. Just when you think it’s all about island life and unusual friendships, boom: Roz's creators launch a robotic onslaught to snatch her back to the grid!

12. The Day the Earth Blew Up: A Looney Tunes Movie

Release date: TBC

Porky Pig and Daffy Duck are set to return to our screens in 2024!

The Day the Earth Blew Up: A Looney Tunes Movie is the first-ever fully animated Looney Tunes feature-length movie to make it to the big screen and promises to be a huge hit amongst families. The animated comedy follows the hilarious antics of Porky and Daffy as they become two unlikely heroes in the face of an alien invasion.

13. Noah's Ark: A Musical Adventure

Release date: 19 September 2024

Noah's Ark: A Musical Adventure spins the classic biblical tale into a quirky, tune-filled escapade that's anything but your Sunday school story.

Vini, a mouse with the heart of a poet but the stage fright of a novice, teams up with Tito, a mouse maestro wielding a guitar like a rock star. As the skies open up, these two furry critters face the ultimate gatecrashers' challenge: sneaking onto the legendary Noah's Ark where the guest list is as exclusive as it gets – one male and one female from each species, no exceptions. Cue an ingenious cockroach with a knack for bending rules, and suddenly Vini and Tito are in, dodging paws and hooves. But as cabin fever sets in among the carnivores and herbivores, it's up to our unlikely heroes and a soundtrack of groovy tunes inspired by the legendary Vinicius de Moraes to turn a potential furry feud into an onboard bash.

14. Moana 2

Release date: 22 November 2024

What can we say except, you're welcome! After much gossip and speculation, a Moana sequel is underway with an Australian release date of 27 November 2024 confirmed by Disney.

Moana is setting sail again in Moana 2 after receiving an unexpected call from her wayfinding ancestors. Moana must journey to the far seas of Oceania and into dangerous, long-lost waters for an adventure unlike anything she’s ever faced - we can't wait to join her!

15. Wicked: Part One

Release date: 28 November 2024

Go back in time to before Elphaba Thropp became the Wicked Witch of the West in one of the most highly anticipated kids' movies for 2024, Wicked.

The newest remake of Wicked is set to be released in two parts, with Part One hitting our screens in late November 2024. Ariana Grande will star as Glinda (the Good Witch of the South) alongside Cynthia Erivo as Elphaba who meet at Shiz University in the fantastical Land of Oz and quickly forge an unlikely friendship that culminates in the ultimate battle of good versus evil.

16. Mufasa: The Lion King

Release date: 19 December 2024

Walt Disney Studios are bringing back one of their most beloved Disney characters of all time: Simba!

Get ready to go back to Pride Rock in Mufasa: The Lion King. The live-action photorealistic computer-animated prequel is similar to the 2019 remake and follows Simba as he steps into his father's footsteps as king of the Pride Lands. The origins of Simba's late father Mufasa are explored in Mufasa: The Lion King as Simba grapples with being a father himself.

17. Sonic the Hedgehog 3

Release date: 20 December 2024

If you've got little Sonic fans in the house, then add Sonic the Hedgehog 3 to your list of new family movies coming out in 2024.

Sonic the Hedgehog 3 is bringing back Ben Schwartz as Sonic, Colleen O’Shaughnessey as Tails, and Idris Elba as Knuckles in this sequel that's set to be even better than its predecessor. A new villain, Shadow the Hedgehog was teased in Sonic 2 so get ready for an all-out battle in another adaptation of the beloved video game series.

18. 'The Aristocats' live-action remake

Release date: TBA

Mark your calendars and prepare to be whisked away to the enchanting streets of Paris with Disney's latest announcement: a live-action/hybrid remake of the beloved classic, 'The Aristocats.' Directed by the Oscar-winning Ahmir “Questlove” Thompson, in his feature film directing debut, this reimagination is set to bring a fresh twist to the heartwarming tale of a family of Parisian felines.

With Questlove also overseeing the music and executive producing, alongside a script penned by Will Gluck and Keith Bunin, this film promises a delightful blend of nostalgia and innovation. Produced by Gluck's Olive Bridge and Thompson’s Two One Five, the story follows the aristocratic cat family as they navigate a daring adventure through the countryside, aided by a charming alley cat, after being kidnapped by their owner's greedy butler.

As a founding member of The Roots and a six-time Grammy winner, Questlove's transition from the director of the acclaimed documentary 'Summer of Soul' to the helm of 'The Aristocats' is eagerly anticipated by fans and critics alike. Stay tuned for a journey filled with music, mischief, and the timeless magic of Disney.

And in 2025...

Paddington in Peru

Release date: 1 January 2025

Everyone's favourite ultra-polite bear is back in another instalment from the Paddington Bear series, Paddington in Peru.

Paddington in Peru follows Paddington and his adopted family on a crazy adventure through the wilds of the Amazon rainforest in Peru.

Dog Man: The Movie

Release date: TBA

That's right! Dog Man is finally being made into a movie!

Dog Man: The Movie will make its way onto our screens with - you guessed it! - everyone favourite half dog and half man, who is sworn to protect and serve as he doggedly pursues the feline supervillain Petey the Cat. More details are yet to be released but until then, we'll keep a close eye on the release date!

Minecraft: The Movie

Release date: 3 April 2025

The malevolent Ender Dragon sets out on a path of destruction, prompting a young girl and her group of unlikely adventurers to set out to save the Overworld in the 2025 instalment of Minecraft: The Movie.

Jason Momoa, Jack Black, Jennifer Coolidge, and Kate McKinnon are set to voice the characters in Minecraft: The Movie so it's safe to say this is one movie we don't want to miss!
